00024 /****************************************************************************************************
00025 @brief Load kernel source from file
00026 @param source file with kernel source
00027 ***************************************************************************************************/
00028 string TCompute::LoadSource(const char* source)
00029 {
00030   ifstream fin(source);
00031   if(!fin)
00032   {
00033     string msg = "Cannot open kernel source ";
00034     msg += source;
00035     ShowMessage(msg.c_str(), false);
00036     return "null";
00037   }
00038   string data;
00039   char ch;
00040   while(fin.get(ch))
00041     data+=ch;
00042 
00043   return data;
00044 }

00047 /****************************************************************************************************
00048 @brief Initialize OpenCL device, create context and command queue
00049 @return success/fail of initialization
00050 ***************************************************************************************************/
00051 bool TCompute::InitCL()
00052 {
00053         //get platform
00054   cl_platform_id platform = NULL;
00055         status = clGetPlatformIDs(1, &platform, NULL);
00056         if(status != CL_SUCCESS)
00057           return false;
00058 
00059         //find the GPU CL device
00060         status = clGetDeviceIDs(platform, CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU, 1, &device, NULL);
00061         assert(device);
00062 
00063         //get some information about the returned device
00064         cl_char vendor_name[1024] = {0};
00065         cl_char device_name[1024] = {0};
00066         status = clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_VENDOR, sizeof(vendor_name), vendor_name, NULL);
00067         status |= clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_NAME, sizeof(device_name), device_name, NULL);
00068         assert(status == CL_SUCCESS);
00069         printf("Connecting to %s %s...\n", vendor_name, device_name);
00070 
00071         //create a context to perform our calculation with the specified device
00072         context = clCreateContext(0, 1, &device, NULL, NULL, &status);
00073         assert(status == CL_SUCCESS);
00074 
00075         //command queue for the context
00076         commandQueue = clCreateCommandQueue(context, device, CL_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE, &status);
00077 
00078   //some device specific Information
00079   status = clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, sizeof(size_t), (void*)&maxWorkGroupSize, NULL);
00080   status = clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS, sizeof(cl_uint), (void*)&maxDimensions, NULL);
00081   maxWorkItemSizes = new size_t[maxDimensions];
00082   status = clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES, sizeof(size_t) * maxDimensions, (void*)maxWorkItemSizes, NULL);
00083   status = clGetDeviceInfo(device,  CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE, sizeof(cl_ulong), (void *)&totalLocalMemory, NULL);
00084         assert(status == CL_SUCCESS);
00085 
00086         return true;
00087 }

00090 /****************************************************************************************************
00091 @brief Load, compile and setup kernel object
00092 @param source_file path to file with kernel source
00093 @param func_name function name in kernel
00094 @return success/fail of kernel creation
00095 ***************************************************************************************************/
00096 bool TCompute::SetupKernel(const char* source_file, const char* func_name)
00097 {
00098   //create a CL program using the kernel source
00099         string str_source = LoadSource(source_file);
00100         const char* source = str_source.c_str();
00101         size_t sourceSize[] = { str_source.length() };
00102         program = clCreateProgramWithSource(context,1, &source, sourceSize, &status);
00103         assert(status == CL_SUCCESS);
00104 
00105   //create a cl program executable for all the devices specified
00106   status = clBuildProgram(program, 1, &device, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00107   if(status != CL_SUCCESS)
00108   {
00109     if(status == CL_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE)
00110     {
00111                         ShowMessage("Build program failed!",false);
00112       cl_int logStatus;
00113       char * buildLog = NULL;
00114       size_t buildLogSize = 0;
00115       logStatus = clGetProgramBuildInfo(program, device, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, buildLogSize, buildLog, &buildLogSize);
00116       buildLog = new char[buildLogSize];
00117       assert(buildLog != NULL);
00118       memset(buildLog, 0, buildLogSize);
00119 
00120       logStatus = clGetProgramBuildInfo (program, device, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG, buildLogSize, buildLog, NULL);
00121                         assert(logStatus == CL_SUCCESS);
00122 
00123       cout<<buildLog<<endl;
00124       delete [] buildLog;
00125     }
00126                 return false;
00127   }
00128 
00129   //get a kernel object handle for a kernel with the given name
00130   kernel = clCreateKernel(program, func_name, &status);
00131         assert(status == CL_SUCCESS);
00132 
00133   //get optimal work group memory size from device
00134         status = clGetKernelWorkGroupInfo(kernel, device,  CL_KERNEL_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE, sizeof(cl_ulong), &usedLocalMemory, NULL);
00135         assert(status == CL_SUCCESS);
00136   if(usedLocalMemory > totalLocalMemory)
00137   {
00138       ShowMessage("Unsupported: Insufficient local memory on device.",false);
00139       return false;
00140   }
00141 
00142         groupSize = 256;
00143         //check if group size isn't greater than supported
00144   if(groupSize > maxWorkItemSizes[0] || groupSize > maxWorkGroupSize)
00145   {
00146                 //then get optimal work group size
00147                 status = clGetKernelWorkGroupInfo(kernel, device, CL_KERNEL_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, sizeof(size_t), &groupSize, 0);
00148                 assert(status == CL_SUCCESS);
00149   }
00150         cout<<"Work group size: "<<groupSize<<endl;
00151 
00152         return SetupKernelArgs();
00153 }

00155 /****************************************************************************************************
00156 @brief Destroy OpenCL context and program objects
00157 @return success/fail of data release
00158 ***************************************************************************************************/
00159 bool TCompute::Destroy()
00160 {
00161   //releases OpenCL resources (Context, Memory etc.)
00162   cl_int status;
00163 
00164   status = clReleaseKernel(kernel);
00165   status |= clReleaseProgram(program);
00166   status |= clReleaseCommandQueue(commandQueue);
00167   status |= clReleaseContext(context);
00168 
00169   if(maxWorkItemSizes)
00170     delete [] maxWorkItemSizes;
00171 
00172         if(status == CL_SUCCESS)
00173                 return true;
00174         else
00175                 return false;
00176 }
